data.name: Dark Croconaw

attacks.name: Clamping Jaw
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn. If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing. (Benching either Pokémon ends this effect.)

data.flavorText: It has 49 teeth in its mouth that are constantly replacing themselves. Pull one out, and a new one grows in.

data.name: Trapinch

attacks.name: Mini Earthquake
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage to each of your Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: As it digs through the sand, its giant jaws crush any rocks that obstruct its path. It builds a funnel-shaped nest.

data.name: Golduck

attacks.name: Psyshock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Hyper Beam
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has any Energy cards attached to it, choose 1 of them and discard it.

data.flavorText: Often seen swimming elegantly by lake shores. It is often mistaken for the Japanese monster, Kappa.

data.name: Alolan Geodude

attacks.name: Charge
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Lightning Energy cards and attach them to this Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Smash Bomb
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.flavorText: If you mistake it for a rock and step on it, it will headbutt you in anger. In addition to the pain, it will also zap you with a shock.

data.name: Lurantis

abilities.name: Sunny Day
abilities.text: The attacks of your Grass Pokémon and Fire Pokémon do 20 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.flavorText: It requires a lot of effort to maintain Lurantis's vivid coloring, but some collectors enjoy this work and treat it as their hobby.

data.name: Victini

attacks.name: Victory Sign
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 basic Energy cards of different types and attach them to your Pokémon in any way you like. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.flavorText: This Pokémon brings victory. It is said that Trainers with Victini always win, regardless of the type of encounter.

data.name: Heliolisk

attacks.name: Parabolic Spark
attacks.text: Discard as many Lightning Energy attached to your Pokémon as you like. This attack does 30 damage times the number of Energy cards you discarded.

data.flavorText: They flare their frills and generate energy. A single Heliolisk can generate sufficient electricity to power a skyscraper.

data.name: Golduck

attacks.name: Amnesia
attacks.text: Choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon's attacks. The Pokémon can't use that attack during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Aquafall
attacks.text: Discard all Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: When its forehead shines mysteriously, Golduck can use the full extent of its power.

abilities.name: Plunge
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Poliwrath is on your Bench, you may flip a coin. If heads, take all Energy cards attached to your Active Pokémon, if any, and attach them to Poliwrath. Then switch Poliwrath with your Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Water Punch
attacks.text: Flip a number of coins equal to the amount of Water Energy attached to Poliwrath. This attack does 40 damage plus 10 more damage for each heads.

data.name: Vanillite

attacks.name: Triple Spin
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage for each heads.

data.flavorText: Born of an icicle, this Pokémon uses its frosty breath to make ice crystals, causing snow to fall.

data.name: Palkia

attacks.name: Spiral Drain
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It is said to live in a gap in the spatial dimension parallel to ours. It appears in mythology.

data.name: Greninja

abilities.name: Mist Concealment
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon, you may prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon by your opponent's Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Shadow Bullet
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness or Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: It creates throwing stars out of compressed water. When it spins them and throws them at high speed, these stars can split metal in two.

abilities.name: Cheerful Voice
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may use this power. If you do, your turn ends. During your next turn, each of Ludicolo's attacks does 60 more damage to the Defending Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance). This power can't be used if Ludicolo is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Mad Dance
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Best Dance
attacks.text: After doing damage, remove from Ludicolo the number of damage counters equal to the damage you did to the Defending Pokémon. Ludicolo can't use Best Dance during your next turn.

data.name: Guzzlord

attacks.name: Lord's Valley
attacks.text: If you have exactly 2, 4, or 6 Prize cards remaining, discard the top 10 cards of your deck.

data.flavorText: A dangerous Ultra Beast, it appears to be eating constantly, but for some reason its droppings have never been found.

data.name: Carvanha
data.flavorText: They swarm any foe that invades their territory. Their sharp fangs can tear out boat hulls.

data.name: Azelf

attacks.name: Trading Places
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Psyjamming
attacks.text: Move as many Special Energy attached to your opponent's Pokémon to your opponent's other Pokémon in any way you like.

data.flavorText: When Azelf flew, people gained the determination to do things. It was the birth of willpower.

data.name: Kakuna

attacks.name: Stiffen
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to Kakuna during your opponent's next turn. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.)

attacks.name: Poisonpowder
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.flavorText: Almost incapable of moving, this Pokémon can only harden its shell to protect itself from predators.

data.name: Butterfree

attacks.name: Whirlwind
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, he or she chooses 1 of them and switches it with the Defending Pokémon. (Do the damage before switching the Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Mega Drain
attacks.text: Remove a number of damage counters from Butterfree equal to half the damage done to the Defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance) (rounded up to the nearest 10). If Butterfree has fewer damage counters than that, remove all of them.

data.flavorText: In battle, it flaps its wings at high speed to release highly toxic dust into the air.

data.name: Growlithe

attacks.name: Odor Sleuth
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, put a card from your discard pile into your hand.

data.flavorText: It has a brave and trustworthy nature. It fearlessly stands up to bigger and stronger foes.

data.name: Raboot
data.flavorText: Its thick and fluffy fur protects it from the cold and enables it to use hotter fire moves.

data.name: Magma Pointer
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
The Team Magma Pokémon this card is attached to can also use the attack on this card. (You still need the necessary Energy to use this attack.)
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

attacks.name: Magma Pointer
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

abilities.name: Safeguard
abilities.text: Prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Wobbuffet by your opponent's Pokémon-ex.

attacks.name: Flip Over
attacks.text: Wobbuffet does 10 damage to itself, and don't apply Weakness and Resistance to this damage.

data.name: Krabby
data.flavorText: If it senses danger approaching, it cloaks itself with bubbles from its mouth so it will look bigger.

attacks.name: Double Tackle
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to each Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Crushing Blow
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

data.name: Mudkip
data.flavorText: To alert it, the fin on its head senses the flow of water. It has the strength to heft boulders.

data.name: M Slowbro-EX
rules: Mega Evolution rule: When 1 of your Pokémon becomes a Mega Evolution Pokémon, your turn ends.
Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Loll Roll Spin
attacks.text: This Pokémon is now Confused. During your next turn, this Pokémon's Loll Roll Spin attack does 100 more damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Horsea

attacks.name: Water Arrow
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: Known to shoot down flying bugs with precision blasts of ink from the surface of the water.

data.name: Prinplup

attacks.name: Bubble Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: It lives a solitary life. Its wings deliver wicked blows that can snap even the thickest of trees.

data.name: Staryu

attacks.name: Reckless Charge
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: Even if its body is torn, it can regenerate as long as the glowing central core remains intact.

data.name: Poliwrath

attacks.name: Split Spiral Punch
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Wake-Up Slap
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is affected by a Special Condition, this attack does 80 more damage. Then, remove all Special Conditions from that Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Its percentage of body fat is nearly zero. Its body is entirely muscle, which makes it heavy and forces its swimming prowess to develop.

abilities.name: Dark Gaze
abilities.text: As long as Umbreon is your Active Pokémon, Benched Pokémon (yours and your opponent's) can't use Poké-Powers.

attacks.name: Sharp Claws
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 30 more damage.

attacks.name: Paralyzing Gaze
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Knock Off
attacks.text: Choose 1 card from your opponent's hand without looking and discard it.

data.name: Piplup

attacks.name: Fury Attack
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: A poor walker, it often falls down. However, its strong pride makes it puff up its chest without a care.

data.name: Tangrowth

attacks.name: Grind
attacks.text: Does 20 damage times the number of Energy attached to Tangrowth.

attacks.name: Plow Over
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed. If tails, put 1 Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon in the Lost Zone.

data.flavorText: Its vines grow so profusely that, in the warm season, you can't even see its eyes.

data.name: Aurorus

attacks.name: Frost Wall
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from Evolution Pokémon.

attacks.name: Blizzard Burn
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't attack during your next turn.

data.flavorText: Using its diamond-shaped crystals, it can instantly create a wall of ice to block an opponent's attack.

abilities.name: Flower Supplement
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, attach 1 basic Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Benched Pokémon. This power can't be used if Bellossom is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Knife Leaf
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Graveler

attacks.name: Mudslide
attacks.text: Discard 2 Fighting Energy from this Pokémon. This attack does 80 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: It climbs up cliffs as it heads toward the peak of a mountain. As soon as it reaches the summit, it rolls back down the way it came.

attacks.name: Screechy Voice
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is an Evolved Pokémon, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Push Away
attacks.text: Look at your opponent's hand, choose a Trainer card you find there, and discard it.

data.name: Articuno-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Legendary Ascent
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench during your turn, you may switch it with your Active Pokémon. If you do, move any number of Water Energy from your other Pokémon to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Cold Crush-GX
attacks.text: Discard all Energy from both Active Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

attacks.name: Searing Flame
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Firebreathing
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 20 more damage.

abilities.name: Thick Skin
abilities.text: Zangoose can't be affected by any Special Conditions.

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Sharp Claws
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Resonate
attacks.text: Your opponent switches each Defending Pokémon with his or her Benched Pokémon. If your opponent has only 1 Benched Pokémon, you choose the Defending Pokémon to switch.

attacks.name: Healing Sound
attacks.text: Remove 3 damage counters from each of your Active Pokémon. Each Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

abilities.name: Temperamental Weather
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for Castform, Rain Castform, or Snow-cloud Castform and switch it with Sunny Castform. (Any cards attached to Sunny Castform, damage counters, Special Conditions, and effects on it are now on the new Pokémon.) Shuffle Sunny Castform back into your deck. You can't use more than 1 Temperamental Weather Poké-Power each turn.

attacks.name: Sunshine
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for a Stadium card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand.

attacks.name: Sunburn
attacks.text: If High Pressure System is in play, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

data.name: Noctowl

attacks.name: See Beyond
attacks.text: Choose a card from your hand and put it as a Prize card face up. Then, choose 1 of your face-down Prize cards without looking and put it into your hand. This attack does nothing if all of your Prize cards are face up.

attacks.name: Extrasensory
attacks.text: If you have the same number of cards in your hand as your opponent, this attack does 30 damage plus 50 more damage.

data.flavorText: Its eyes are special. They can pick out objects as long as there is the tiniest amount of light.

data.name: Klang

attacks.name: Metal Sound
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Guard Press
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to this Pokémon by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.flavorText: Spinning minigears are rotated at high speed and repeatedly fired away. It is dangerous if the gears don't return.

data.name: Vespiquen

attacks.name: Commanding Queen
attacks.text: If you have 4 or fewer Grass Pokémon on your Bench, this attack does nothing.

data.flavorText: Its abdomen is a honeycomb for grubs. It raises its grubs on honey collected by Combee.

data.name: Claydol

attacks.name: Rewind
attacks.text: Devolve each of your opponent's evolved Pokémon and put the highest Stage Evolution card on it into your opponent's hand.

attacks.name: Hyper Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It is said that it originates from clay dolls made by an ancient civilization.

attacks.name: Body Slam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Deoxys Speed Forme

abilities.name: Form Change
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for any Deoxys and switch it with Deoxys Speed Forme. (Any cards attached to Deoxys Speed Forme, damage counters, Special Conditions, and effects on it are now on the new Pokémon.) If you do, put Deoxys Speed Forme on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward. You can't use more than 1 Form Change Poké-Power each turn.

attacks.name: Speed Shot
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage to that Pokémon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on that Pokémon.

data.flavorText: An alien virus that fell to earth on a meteor underwent a DNA mutation to become this Pokémon.

data.name: Gothita

attacks.name: Psybeam
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

data.flavorText: They intently observe both Trainers and Pokémon. Apparently, they are looking at something only Gothita can see.

data.name: Banette

abilities.name: Tool Concealment
abilities.text: Each Pokémon Tool card in play has no effect.

data.flavorText: Strong feelings of hatred turned a puppet into a Pokémon. If it opens its mouth, its cursed energy escapes.

attacks.name: Dragon Crush
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage to each Defending Pokémon. Discard an Energy card from each Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Aqua Sonic
attacks.text: This attack's damage is not affected by Resistance.

data.name: Crawdaunt

attacks.name: Double Claws
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It is a ruffian that uses its pincers to pick up and toss out other Pokémon from its pond.

data.name: Slowking

abilities.name: Trump Card
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if any of your Pokémon were Knocked Out during your opponent's last turn, search your deck for any 1 card and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward. This power can't be used if Slowking is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Psych Up
attacks.text: During your next turn, Slowking's Psych Up attack's base damage is 60.

data.flavorText: Being bitten by Shellder gave it intelligence comparable to that of award-winning scientists.

data.name: Corsola

attacks.name: Recover
attacks.text: Discard a Water Energy attached to Corsola and remove all damage counters from Corsola.

attacks.name: Hyper Cannon
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If both of them are heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 50 more damage.

data.flavorText: It continuously sheds and grows. The tip of its head is prized as a treasure because of its beauty.

data.name: Clawitzer BREAK
rules: BREAK Evolution Rule: Clawitzer BREAK retains the attacks, Abilities, Weakness, Resistance, and Retreat Cost of its previous Evolution.

attacks.name: Lock-On
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn. During your next turn, any damage done to that Pokémon by attacks is increased by 120 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Bronzor

attacks.name: Extrasensory
attacks.text: If you have the same number of cards in your hand as your opponent, this attack does 30 damage plus 30 more damage.

data.flavorText: There are researchers who believe this Pokémon reflected like a mirror in the distant past.

data.name: Grotle

attacks.name: Sleep Powder
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: A Grotle that lives in the forest is said to have its own secret springwater.

data.name: Snorlax

attacks.name: Rock Smash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

data.flavorText: It is not satisfied unless it eats over 880 pounds of food every day. When it is done eating, it goes promptly to sleep.

data.name: Samurott

abilities.name: Shell Armor
abilities.text: Any damage done to this Pokémon by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Hydro Pump
attacks.text: Does 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Part of the armor on its anterior legs becomes a giant sword. Its cry alone is enough to intimidate most enemies.

attacks.name: Steep Dive
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of an attack, including damage, done to Swellow during your opponent's next turn. If tails, during your next turn, Swellow's Glide attack's base damage is 100.

abilities.name: Battle Rush
abilities.text: If your opponent has any Pokémon in play that has maximum HP of 120 or more, ignore all Colorless Energy necessary to use Salamence's attacks.

attacks.name: Steam Twister
attacks.text: Discard a Fire Energy and a Water Energy attached to Salamence.

attacks.name: Time Spiral
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Evolved Pokémon in play, choose 1 of them and flip a coin. If heads, remove the highest Stage Evolution card on that Pokémon and have your opponent shuffle it into his or her deck.

attacks.name: Haunt
attacks.text: Put 2 damage counters on the Defending Pokémon.

abilities.name: Tropical Heal
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you put Tropius from your hand onto your Bench, you may remove all Special Conditions, Imprison markers, and Shock-wave markers from your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Grind
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the amount of Energy attached to Tropius.

data.name: Sharpedo

abilities.name: Rough Skin
abilities.text: If Sharpedo is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if Sharpedo is Knocked Out), put 2 damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon.

attacks.name: Strike Wound
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has 2 or more damage counters on it, this attack does 60 damage plus 20 more damage. This attack damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on that Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Its fangs rip through sheet iron. It swims at 75 mph and is known as "The Bully of the Sea."

abilities.name: Natural Cure
abilities.text: When you attach a Water Energy card from your hand to Lombre, remove all Special Conditions from Lombre.

attacks.name: Blot
attacks.text: Remove 2 damage counters from Lombre.

data.name: Kabutops

attacks.name: Hydrocutter
attacks.text: Flip a number of coins equal to the number of Energy cards attached to Kabutops. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads. You can't flip more than 3 coins in this way.

data.flavorText: In the water, it tucks its limbs to become more compact, then it wiggles its shell to swim fast.

data.name: Ariados

attacks.name: Spider Web
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat. (Benching or evolving that Pokémon ends this effect.)

attacks.name: Poison Bite
attacks.text: If this attack damages the Defending Pokémon, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned and you remove a number of damage counters from Ariados equal to half that damage (rounded up to the nearest 10). If Ariados has fewer damage counters than that, remove all of them.

data.flavorText: It spins string not only from its rear but also from its mouth. It's hard to tell which end is which.

attacks.name: Double Stab
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Galarian Darmanitan

attacks.name: Frozen Heat
attacks.text: You may discard all Water Energy from this Pokémon. If you do, this attack does 60 more damage.

data.flavorText: Anger has reignited its atrophied flame sac. This Pokémon spews fire everywhere as it rampages indiscriminately.

abilities.name: Territoriality
abilities.text: If your Active Pokémon is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if that Pokémon is Knocked Out), put 2 damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon. You can't put more than 2 damage counters in this way.

attacks.name: Fling Away
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, this attack's base damage is 30 instead of 60 and this attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Giga Horn
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If both of them are tails, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Omastar

abilities.name: Primal Swirl
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you play Omastar from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon, you may remove the highest Stage Evolution card from each of your opponent's Benched Evolved Pokémon and put those cards back into his or her hand. You can't use more than 1 Primal Swirl Poké-Power each turn.

attacks.name: Send Back
attacks.text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It is thought that this Pokémon became extinct because its spiral shell grew too large.

data.name: Dark Vileplume

abilities.name: Hay Fever
abilities.text: No Trainer cards can be played. This power stops working while Dark Vileplume is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Petal Whirlwind
attacks.text: Flip a coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads. If you get 2 or more heads, Dark Vileplume is now Confused (after doing damage).

data.flavorText: Perhaps because of their strong-smelling pollen, other Pokémon do not approach areas where Vileplumes live.

data.name: Cloyster

attacks.name: Sudden Grip
attacks.text: If this Pokémon evolved from Shellder during this turn, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: Its shell is extremely hard. It cannot be shattered, even with a bomb. The shell opens only when it is attacking.

data.name: Vanillish

attacks.name: Ice Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: It conceals itself from enemy eyes by creating many small ice particles and hiding among them.

data.name: Seismitoad

attacks.name: Echoed Voice
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon's Echoed Voice attack does 50 more damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Drain Punch
attacks.text: Heal 20 damage from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: They shoot paralyzing liquid from their head bumps. They use vibration to hurt their opponents.

data.name: Samurott

attacks.name: Pike
attacks.text: Does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: Part of the armor on its anterior legs becomes a giant sword. Its cry alone is enough to intimidate most enemies.

data.name: Phione

attacks.name: Pull Out
attacks.text: Put a card from your discard pile on top of your deck.

attacks.name: Aqua Boomerang
attacks.text: Return this Pokémon and all cards attached to it to your hand.

data.flavorText: It drifts in warm seas. It always returns to where it was born, no matter how far it may have drifted.

data.name: Dusknoir

abilities.name: Dark Hide
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, look at your opponent's hand, choose a Pokémon you find there, and put it on the bottom of his or her deck. This power can't be used if Dusknoir is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Reaper Pulse
attacks.text: Move up to 2 damage counters from Dusknoir to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: The antenna on its head captures radio waves from the world of spirits that command it to take people there.

data.name: Porygon2

abilities.name: Shortcut
abilities.text: The Retreat Cost for each Porygon, Porygon2, and Porygon-Z you have in play is Colorless less.

attacks.name: Reckless Charge
attacks.text: Porygon2 does 10 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: This upgraded version of Porygon is designed for space exploration. It can't fly, though.

data.name: Duskull

attacks.name: Revival
attacks.text: Put a Basic Pokémon from your opponent's discard pile onto his or her Bench.

attacks.name: Sneaky Placement
attacks.text: Put 1 damage counter on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It doggedly pursues its prey wherever it goes. However, the chase is abandoned at sunrise.

data.name: Metang

attacks.name: Double Smash
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 50 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: When two Beldum fuse together, a magnetic nervous system places their brains in union.

data.name: Clauncher

attacks.name: Bubble
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: They knock down flying prey by firing compressed water from their massive claws like shooting a pistol.

data.name: Kyurem

attacks.name: Frost Spear
attacks.text: Does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Blizzard Burn
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't attack during your next turn.

data.flavorText: This legendary ice Pokémon waits for a hero to fill in the missing parts of its body with truth or ideals.

data.name: Marshtomp

attacks.name: Endeavor
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 more damage for each heads.

data.flavorText: Living on muddy ground that provides poor footing has made its legs sturdy.

data.name: Kricketune

attacks.name: Sore Performance
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Concerto
attacks.text: Does 40 damage plus 10 more damage for each Kricketot and each Kricketune you have in play.

data.flavorText: It crosses its knifelike arms in front of its chest when it cries. It can compose melodies ad lib.

data.name: Phione

attacks.name: Charm
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done by attacks from the Defending Pokémon is reduced by 20 (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Whirlpool
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

data.flavorText: A Pokémon that lives in warm seas. It inflates the flotation sac on its head to drift and search for food.

data.name: Tsareena

abilities.name: Queenly Majesty
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may have your opponent reveal their hand. Then, discard a card from it.

attacks.name: Trop Kick
attacks.text: Heal 20 damage and remove all Special Conditions from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Its long, striking legs aren't just for show but to be used to kick with skill. In victory, it shows off by kicking the defeated, laughing boisterously.

data.name: Golbat

attacks.name: Screech
attacks.text: Until the end of your next turn, if an attack damages the Defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance), that attack does 20 more damage to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Poison Bite
attacks.text: If this attack damages the Defending Pokémon, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned and you remove a number of damage counters from Golbat equal to half that damage (rounded up to the nearest 10). If Golbat has fewer damage counters than that, remove all of them. Either way, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.flavorText: It can drink more than 10 ounces of blood at once. If it has too much, it gets heavy and flies clumsily.

data.name: Torracat

attacks.name: Fire Fang
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

data.flavorText: It can act spoiled if it grows close to its Trainer. A powerful Pokémon, its sharp claws can leave its Trainer's whole body covered in scratches.

data.name: Charmeleon

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard 1 Fire Energy card attached to Charmeleon in order to use this attack.

data.flavorText: When it swings its burning tail, it raises the temperature to unbearably high levels.

abilities.name: Happy Healing
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), choose 1 of your Benched Pokémon and flip a coin. If heads, count the number of Energy attached to Blissey and then remove that many damage counters from the chosen Benched Pokémon. This power can't be used if Blissey is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Smash Bomber
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Shellder
data.flavorText: The hardness of its shell surpasses the hardness of a diamond. In days gone by, people used the shells to make shields.

data.name: Wailmer

attacks.name: Hydro Pump
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage for each Water Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It shows off by spraying jets of seawater from the nostrils above its eyes. It eats a solid ton of Wishiwashi every day.

attacks.name: Target Scorch
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has Team Aqua in its name, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Damage Burn
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, this attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage.

data.name: Bayleef

attacks.name: Poisonpowder
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Pollen Shield
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, Bayleef can't become Asleep, Confused, Paralyzed, or Poisoned. (All other effects of attacks, Pokémon Powers and Trainer cards still happen.)

data.flavorText: A spicy aroma emanates from around its neck. The aroma acts as a stimulant to restore health.

attacks.name: Surprise
attacks.text: Choose 1 card from your opponent's hand without looking. Look at the card you chose, then have your opponent shuffle that card into his or her deck.

data.name: Scyther

attacks.name: Swords Dance
attacks.text: During your next turn, Scyther's Slash attack's base damage is 60 instead of 30.

data.flavorText: With ninja-like agility and speed, it can create the illusion that there is more than one of it.

data.name: Kakuna

attacks.name: Speed Evolution
attacks.text: Search your deck for a card that evolves from Kakuna and put it onto Kakuna. (This counts as evolving Kakuna.) Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Poison Sting
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.flavorText: Although it is a cocoon, it can move a little. It can extend its poison barb if it is attacked.

data.name: Magikarp

attacks.name: Epic Splash
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If either of them is tails, this attack does nothing.

data.flavorText: In the distant past, it was somewhat stronger than the horribly weak descendants that exist today.

attacks.name: Swift
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Pokémon Powers, or any other effects on the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Needle Ball
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.name: Golem

attacks.name: Rock Slide
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to 3 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: When Golem grow old, they stop shedding their shells. Those that have lived a long, long time have shells green with moss.

data.name: Vanillish

attacks.name: Ice Shard
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Fighting Pokémon, this attack does 30 more damage.

data.flavorText: Hot days cause its body to melt. It can be restored by refreezing it, but the process leaves its body slightly warped.

data.name: Voltorb
data.flavorText: It looks just like a Poké Ball. It is dangerous because it may electrocute or explode on touch.

data.name: Unown [H]

abilities.name: HEAL
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if you have Unown H, Unown E, Unown A, and Unown L on your Bench, you may remove all Special Conditions from 1 of your Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Hidden Power
attacks.text: Discard a card from your hand. (If you can't discard a card from your hand, this attack does nothing.)

data.flavorText: Shaped like ancient writing, it is a huge mystery whether language or UNOWN came first.

data.name: Sharpedo

abilities.name: Rough Skin
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if this Pokémon is Knocked Out), put 2 damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon.

attacks.name: Hard Bite
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.flavorText: Its fangs rip through sheet iron. It swims at 75 mph and is known as

data.name: Staryu
data.flavorText: It appears in large numbers by seashores. At night, its central core flashes with a red light.

data.name: Luvdisc

attacks.name: Love Call
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. Search your deck for a Pokémon that is the same type as the Pokémon you chose, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Sweet Kiss
attacks.text: Your opponent may draw a card.

data.flavorText: It lives in warm seas. It is said that a couple finding this Pokémon will be blessed with eternal love.

data.name: Typhlosion

attacks.name: Fire Spin
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy attached to Typhlosion.

data.flavorText: It has a secret, devastating move. It rubs its blazing fur together to cause huge explosions.

attacks.name: Sand Pit
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat until the end of your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Dragonbreath
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Croconaw

attacks.name: Big Bite
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

data.flavorText: If it loses a fang, a new one grows back in its place. There are always 48 fangs lining its mouth.

data.name: Krookodile-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Second Bite
attacks.text: This attack does 10 more damage for each damage counter on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Megaton Fang
attacks.text: Discard a card from your hand. If you can't discard a card, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Body Slam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Double-edge
attacks.text: Loudred does 10 damage to itself.

data.name: Zubat

attacks.name: Skill Dive
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: Even though it has no eyes, it can sense obstacles using ultrasonic waves it emits from it mouth.

data.name: Garbodor

abilities.name: Poisonous Puddle
abilities.text: Once during your turn, if a Stadium is in play, you may make your opponent's Active Pokémon Poisoned.

data.flavorText: This Pokémon eats trash, which turns into poison inside its body. The main component of the poison depends on what sort of trash was eaten.

attacks.name: Mid-air Strike
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 30 more damage.

data.name: Starmie

attacks.name: Recover
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon and heal all damage from it.

attacks.name: Core Splash
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has any Psychic Energy attached to it, this attack does 30 more damage.

data.flavorText: Its central core glows with the seven colors of the rainbow. Some people value the core as a gem.

data.name: Feebas

attacks.name: Splashing Dodge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

data.flavorText: A tough Pokémon that is perfectly fine even in dirty water. However, due to its ragged, shabby appearance, it isn't popular.

data.name: Marill
data.flavorText: The oil-filled tail functions as a buoy, so it's fine even in rivers with strong currents.

data.name: Sunflora

abilities.name: Grass Whistle
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may remove 1 damage counter from each of your Grass Pokémon. You can't use more than 1 Grass Whistle Poké-Power each turn. This power can't be used if Sunflora is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Petal Dance
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads. If you get 2 or more heads, Sunflora is now Confused.

data.flavorText: It gets energy from warm sunlight and is known for its habit of moving in pursuit of it.

data.name: Banette

ancientTrait.name: Δ Evolution
ancientTrait.text: You may play this card from your hand to evolve a Pokémon during your first turn or the turn you play that Pokémon.

attacks.name: Evolution Jammer
attacks.text: Your opponent can't play any Pokémon from his or her hand to evolve his or her Pokémon during his or her next turn.

attacks.name: Curse Deeply
attacks.text: Put 5 damage counters on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Strong feelings of hatred turned a puppet into a Pokémon. If it opens its mouth, its cursed energy escapes.

data.name: Swanna

attacks.name: Wing Dance
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Air Slash
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It administers sharp, powerful pecks with its bill. It whips its long neck to deliver forceful repeated strikes.

abilities.name: Ancient Protection
abilities.text: Each of your Omanyte, Omastar, Kabuto, Kabutops, and Kabutops ex has no Weakness.

attacks.name: Granite Head
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Kabuto by attacks is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Alomomola

attacks.name: Mysterious Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Double Slap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 50 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: The special membrane enveloping Alomomola has the ability to heal wounds.

data.name: Charmeleon

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: In the rocky mountains where Charmeleon live, their fiery tails shine at night like stars.

data.name: Arcanine

abilities.name: Warming Up
abilities.text: If this Pokémon has a Burning Scarf attached, it gets +100 HP.

data.flavorText: The sight of it running over 6,200 miles in a single day and night has captivated many people.

data.name: Ditto

abilities.name: Ditto DNA
abilities.text: As long as Ditto is your Active Pokémon, its maximum HP is the same as your opponent's Active Pokémon. Ditto can use the attacks of that Pokémon as its own. (You still need the necessary Energy to use each attack.) If that Pokémon is no longer your opponent's Active Pokémon, choose 1 of your opponent's Active Pokémon for Ditto to copy.

data.flavorText: It has the ability to reconstitute its entire cellular structure to transform into whatever it sees.

attacks.name: Vine Tease
attacks.text: Look at your Prize cards without showing your opponent. Choose 1 of the Prize cards and switch it with the top card of your deck without looking at the top card of your deck. If you have no cards in your deck, this attack does nothing.

attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused. If tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.name: Magnemite

attacks.name: Searching Magnet
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 3 Metal Energy cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.flavorText: It sends out electromagnetic waves, which let it float through the air. Touching it while it's eating electricity will give you a full-body shock.

attacks.name: Fast Evolution
attacks.text: Search your deck for an Evolution card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.name: Hydreigon

abilities.name: Weed Out
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may choose 3 of your Benched Pokémon. Then, discard your other Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Dark Destruction
attacks.text: You may discard an Energy from this Pokémon. If you do, discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.flavorText: The heads on their arms do not have brains. They use all three heads to consume and destroy everything.

data.name: Oshawott

attacks.name: Razor Shell
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.flavorText: The scalchop on its stomach is made from the same elements as claws. It detaches the scalchop for use as a blade.

data.name: Kangaskhan

attacks.name: Split Spiral Punch
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Dizzy Punch
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 50 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: If it is safe, the young gets out of the belly pouch to play. The adult keeps a close eye on the youngster.

attacks.name: Fruition
attacks.text: Move 1 Energy card attached to Tropius to another of your Pokémon and remove 4 damage counters from that Pokémon (all if there are less than 4).

data.name: Manaphy

abilities.name: Blessings of the Deep
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may heal 20 damage from 1 of your Pokémon that has any Water Energy attached to it.

data.flavorText: It is born with a wondrous power that lets it bond with any kind of Pokémon.

data.name: Miltank

attacks.name: Sitdown Splash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.flavorText: If it is around babies, it milk it produces contains much more nutrition than usual.

data.name: Larvesta

attacks.name: Singe
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

data.flavorText: It protects itself with flame. Long years ago, people believed Larvesta had a nest on the sun.

data.name: Kyurem-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Frozen Wings
attacks.text: Discard a Special Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Hail Blizzard
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't use Hail Blizzard during your next turn.

data.name: Munna

attacks.name: Focused Wish
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.flavorText: This Pokémon appears before people and Pokémon who are having nightmares and eats those dreams.

abilities.name: Psychic Wing
abilities.text: If Vibrava has any Psychic Energy attached to it, the Retreat Cost for Vibrava is 0.

attacks.name: Quick Blow
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage.

data.name: Solosis

attacks.name: Mini Link
attacks.text: If Solosis is on your Bench, this attack does 30 more damage.

data.flavorText: They drive away attackers by unleashing psychic power. They can use telepathy to talk with others.

data.flavorText: Using air of -150 degrees Fahrenheit, they freeze opponents solid. They live in herds above the snow line on mountains.

data.name: Dusclops

attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Cursed Drop
attacks.text: Put 4 damage counters on your opponent's Pokémon in any way you like.

data.flavorText: Anyone who dares peer into its body to see its spectral ball of fire will have their spirit stolen away.

data.name: Golett

attacks.name: Smash Punch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.flavorText: Ancient science fashioned this Pokémon from clay. It's been active for thousands of years.

data.name: Samurott

abilities.name: Shell Armor
abilities.text: Any damage done to this Pokémon by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Hydro Pump
attacks.text: Does 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Part of the armor on its anterior legs becomes a giant sword. Its cry alone is enough to intimidate most enemies.

abilities.name: Body Odor
abilities.text: As long as Weezing is the Active Pokémon, put 1 damage counter on each of your opponent's Pokémon that has any Poké-Bodies between turns.

attacks.name: Mist Attack
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Golem

attacks.name: Selfdestruct
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to each Pokémon on each player's Bench. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Golem does 100 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: Its boulder-like body is extremely hard. It can easily withstand dynamite blasts without damage.

data.name: Team Aqua Admin
rules: Attach a basic Energy card from your discard pile to your Active Team Aqua Pokémon.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

attacks.text: Discard all Pokémon Tool cards and Special Energy from each of your opponent's Pokémon.

data.flavorText: The males are usually lazy, but when attacked by a strong foe, a male will protect its friends with no regard for its own safety.

data.name: Shaymin

abilities.name: Floral Heal
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may heal 20 damage from your Active Grass Pokémon.

data.flavorText: The blooming of Gracidea flowers confers the power of flight upon it. Feelings of gratitude are the message it delivers.

data.name: Bergmite

attacks.name: Ice Block
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Using air of -150 degrees Fahrenheit, they freeze opponents solid. They live in herds above the snow line on mountains.

attacks.name: Triple Headbutt
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: MAX Burst
attacks.text: Flip a number of coins equal to the number of Energy cards attached to your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: If one of its heads falls off, it turns into an Exeggcute, which begins to look for other Exeggcutes using a special form of telepathy.

attacks.name: Karate Chop
attacks.text: Does 50 damage minus 10 damage for each damage counter on Machoke.

attacks.name: Submission
attacks.text: Machoke does 20 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: Its muscular body is so powerful that it must wear a power-save belt to help regulate its motions.

abilities.name: Solid Shell
abilities.text: Any damage done to Anorith by attacks is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. If 1 of them is heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage. If 2 of them are heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 30 more damage. If all of them are heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 50 more damage.

data.name: Seadra

attacks.name: Water Arrow
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: Its body bristles with sharp spikes. Carelessly trying to touch it could cause fainting from the spikes.

attacks.name: Plasma
attacks.text: If there are any Lightning Energy cards in your discard pile, flip a coin. If heads, attach 1 of them to Raichu.

attacks.name: Shock Bolt
attacks.text: Discard all Lightning Energy cards attached to Raichu or this attack does nothing.

data.name: Alolan Graveler
data.flavorText: When two Graveler fight each other, it fills the surroundings with flashes of light and sound. People call it the "fireworks of the earth."

data.name: Dark Weezing

attacks.name: Mass Explosion
attacks.text: Does 20 damage times the total number of Koffings, Weezings, and Dark Weezings in play (Apply Weakness and Resistance.). Then, this attack does 20 damage to each Koffing, Weezing, and Dark Weezing (even your own). Don't apply Weakness and Resistance.

attacks.name: Stun Gas
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned; if tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: Researchers have observed these Pokémon reproducing in industrial waste sites.

attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage times the number of damage counters on Horsea.

attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

data.name: Vanilluxe

attacks.name: Double Freeze
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads. If either of them is heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: If both heads get angry simultaneously, this Pokémon expels a blizzard, burying everything in snow.

attacks.name: Sludge Drag
attacks.text: Switch the Defending Pokémon with 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. The new Defending Pokémon is now Confused and Poisoned.

attacks.name: Pester
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is affected by a Special Condition, this attack does 50 damage plus 30 more damage.

data.flavorText: Its body is made of a powerful poison. Touching it accidentally will cause a fever that requires bed rest.

abilities.name: Maternal Comfort
abilities.text: At any times between turns, remove 1 damage counter from each of your Pokémon. You can't use more than 1 Maternal Comfort Poké-Body between turns.

attacks.name: Ruthless Tail
attacks.text: Does 50 damage plus 10 more damage for each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Empoleon

attacks.name: Total Command
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage for each Benched Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's).

attacks.name: Whirlpool
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.flavorText: The three horns that extend from its beak attest to its power. The leader has the biggest horns.

data.name: Axew

attacks.name: Dual Chop
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: They use their tusks to crush the berries they eat. Repeated regrowth makes their tusks strong and sharp.

data.name: Galarian Zigzagoon

attacks.name: Pin Missile
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 10 damage for each heads.

data.flavorText: Its restlessness has it constantly running around. If it sees another Pokémon, it will purposely run into them in order to start a fight.

data.flavorText: While shining a light and pretending to be a guide, it leeches off the life force of any who follow it.

data.flavorText: It's drowzy in daytime, but flies off in the evening in big groups. No one knows where they go.

attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Splash Cannon
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage for each Water Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Their enormous claws launch cannonballs of water powerful enough to pierce tanker hulls.

attacks.text: Search your deck for a basic Energy card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.flavorText: It makes fur balls that crackle with static electricity. It stores them with berries in tree holes.

attacks.name: Outrage
attacks.text: Does 10 more damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: This Pokémon appears in legends. It sends flames into the air from its tail, burning up everything around it.

abilities.name: Hard Cocoon
abilities.text: During your opponent's turn, if Cascoon would be damaged by an opponent's attack (after applying Weakness and Resistance), flip a coin. If heads, reduce that damage by 30.

attacks.name: Poison Thread
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.
