attacks.name: Continuous Spin
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: It appears in large numbers by seashores. At night, its central core flashes with a red light.

attacks.name: Healing Pollen
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. For each heads, remove 1 damage counter from each of your Pokémon. If a Pokémon has fewer damage counters than the number of heads, remove all of them.

attacks.name: Sonic Distortion
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If 1 or both of them are heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Cinderace

abilities.name: Libero
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when this Pokémon moves from your Bench to the Active Spot, you may attach up to 2 Fire Energy cards from your discard pile to it.

attacks.name: Flare Striker
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It's skilled at both offense and defense, and it gets pumped up when cheered on. But if it starts showboating, it could put itself in a tough spot.

attacks.name: Poison Fang
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.name: Mudkip

attacks.name: Water Reserve
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 3 Water Energy cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.flavorText: To alert it, the fin on its head senses the flow of water. It has the strength to heft boulders.

data.name: Togepi

attacks.name: Snivel
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon attacks Togepi during your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Togepi is reduced by 20 (before applying Weakness and Resistance). (Benching either Pokémon ends this effect.)

attacks.name: Mini-Metronome
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon's attacks. Mini-Metronome copies that attack except for its Energy cost. (You must still do anything else in order to use that attack.) (No matter what type the Defending Pokémon is, Togepi's type is still Colorless.) Togepi performs that attack.

data.flavorText: Still only a hatchling, it uses poison to chase off its enemies when threatened.

data.name: Hitmonchan

attacks.name: Detect
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Hitmonchan during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Sky Uppercut
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

data.flavorText: Its punches slice the air. However, it seems to need a short break after fighting for three minutes.

abilities.name: Honeycomb Defender
abilities.text: If Scizor has 6 or more damage counters on it, any damage done to Scizor by attacks is reduced by 40 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Accelerate
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is Knocked Out by this attack, prevent all effects of an attack, including damage, done to Scizor during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Pound Down
attacks.text: If you don't have any Pokémon with any Poké-Powers in play, this attack does 40 damage plus 30 more damage.

data.name: Magnemite

attacks.name: Lock-on
attacks.text: During your next turn, treat any tails flipped when using Magnemite's Electric Bolt attack as if they were heads. (Benching or evolving either Pokémon ends this effect.)

attacks.name: Electric Bolt
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If both are heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed. If either of them is tails, this attack does nothing (not even damage).

data.flavorText: These Pokémon are attracted to electrical emissions and will often follow people using PokéGear.

data.name: Golbat

abilities.name: Sneaky Bite
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon, you may put 2 damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

attacks.name: Swoop Across
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: Once it bites, it will not stop draining energy from the victim even if it gets too heavy to fly.

data.name: Dewott

attacks.name: Aqua Tail
attacks.text: Flip a coin for each Water Energy attached to this Pokémon. This attack does 10 more damage for each heads.

data.flavorText: Scalchop techniques differ from one Dewott to another. It never neglects maintaining its scalchops.

data.name: Golurk

ancientTrait.name: θ Stop
ancientTrait.text: Prevent all effects of your opponent's Pokémon's Abilities done to this Pokémon.

abilities.name: Double Type
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is in play, it is Psychic and Fighting type.

attacks.name: Superpower
attacks.text: You may do 40 more damage. If you do, this Pokémon does 20 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: It flies across the sky at Mach speeds. Removing the seal on its chest makes its internal energy go out of control.

data.name: Gyarados-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Stormy Seas
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. For each heads, search your deck for a Water Energy card and attach it to this Pokémon. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Splash Burn
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage to each of your Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Cleffa
rules: If this Baby Pokémon is your Active Pokémon and your opponent announces an attack, your opponent flips a coin (before doing anything else). If tails, your opponent's turn ends.

attacks.name: Eek
attacks.text: Draw 2 cards.

data.flavorText: Because of its unusual, star-like silhouette, people believe that it came here on a meteor.

attacks.name: Double Scratch
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Prinplup

attacks.name: Fury Attack
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: Because every Prinplup considers itself to be the most important, they can never form a group.

data.name: Graveler

attacks.name: Harden
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, whenever 30 or less damage is done to Graveler (after applying Weakness and Resistance), prevent that damage. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.)

data.flavorText: Rolls down slopes to move. It rolls over any obstacle without slowing or changing its direction.

abilities.name: Evolutionary Gas
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), when you play Skuntank from your hand to evolve 1 of your Active Pokémon, you may choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon. If that Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, that attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Poison Claws
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Plunder
attacks.text: Before doing damage, discard all Trainer cards attached to the Defending Pokémon.

data.name: Frillish
data.flavorText: With its thin, veil-like arms wrapped around the body of its opponent, it sinks to the ocean floor.

data.name: Volcarona

attacks.name: Cauterize
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon has no damage counters on it before this attack does damage, this attack does nothing.

data.flavorText: According to legends, it was hatched from a flaming cocoon to save people and Pokémon that were suffering from the cold.

data.name: Galarian Linoone

attacks.name: Double-Edge
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 20 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: It uses its long tongue to taunt opponents. Once the opposition is enraged, this Pokémon hurls itself at the opponent, tackling them forcefully.

abilities.name: Levitate
abilities.text: If Beldum has any Energy attached to it, Beldum's Retreat Cost is 0.

data.name: Kingdra

attacks.name: Brine
attacks.text: This attack does 90 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon that has any damage counters on it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Tornado Shot
attacks.text: Discard a Water Energy from this Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: It is said that it usually hides in underwater caves. It can create whirlpools by yawning.

data.name: Wailord

abilities.name: Water Veil
abilities.text: Whenever you attach an Energy card from your hand to this Pokémon, remove all Special Conditions from it.

attacks.name: Hydro Pump
attacks.text: This attack does 40 more damage for each Water Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It can sometimes knock out opponents with the shock created by breaching and crashing its big body onto the water.

data.name: Metang

attacks.name: Energy Crane
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for up to 2 Psychic Energy cards and attach them to your Pokémon in any way you like.

data.flavorText: When two Beldum fuse together, a magnetic nervous system places their brains in union.

data.name: Delibird

attacks.name: Snowy Present
attacks.text: Draw a card for each Water Energy attached to all of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Hail
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: It nests at the edge of sharp cliffs. It spends all day carrying food to its awaiting chicks.

data.name: Cloyster

attacks.name: Headlock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage. If tails, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Guard Press
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 20 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.flavorText: Its hard shell cannot be shattered—not even by a bomb. The contents of the shell remain unknown.

attacks.name: Damage Burn
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, this attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage.

data.name: Turtonator

attacks.name: Flame Cloak
attacks.text: Attach a Fire Energy card from your discard pile to this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: The shell on its back is chemically unstable and explodes violently if struck. The hole in its stomach is its weak point.

data.name: Lairon

attacks.name: Take Down
attacks.text: Lairon does 20 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: It loves iron ore. Groups of them fight for territory by bashing one another with their steel bodies.

data.name: Skitty

attacks.name: Jump On
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.flavorText: It can't stop itself from chasing moving things, and it runs in a circle, chasing its own tail.

data.name: Dusknoir

abilities.name: Shadow Void
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may move 1 damage counter from 1 of your Pokémon to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Pain Pellets
attacks.text: Put damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon equal to the number of damage counters on this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It is said to take lost spirits into its pliant body and guide them home.

data.name: Manectric

attacks.name: Lightning Twister
attacks.text: Does 20 damage times the number of basic Energy cards attached to Manectric.

attacks.name: Chain Lightning
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon that is the same type as the Defending Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: It discharges electricity from its mane. It creates a thundercloud overhead to drop lightning bolts.

data.name: Cubchoo

attacks.name: Powder Snow
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Rest
attacks.text: Heal 60 damage from this Pokémon. This Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: When it is not feeling well, its mucus gets watery and the power of its Ice-type moves decreases.

data.name: Swampert

attacks.name: Water Arrow
attacks.text: This attack does 60 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: It can swim while towing a large ship. It bashes down foes with a swing of its thick arms.

data.name: Tropical Wind
rules: Flip a coin. If heads, remove 2 damage counters from each Active Pokémon (remove 1 damage counter if a Pokémon has only 1). If tails, each Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.name: Moltres

attacks.name: Wildfire
attacks.text: You may discard any number of Fire Energy cards attached to Moltres when you use this attack. If you do, discard that many cards from the top of your opponent's deck.

attacks.name: Dive Bomb
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.flavorText: Known as the legendary bird of fire. Every flap of its wings creates a dazzling flash of flames.

data.name: Dratini

attacks.name: Wrap
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: After a 10-hour struggle, a fisherman was able to pull one up and confirm its existence.

data.name: Forretress

abilities.name: Iron Shell
abilities.text: Whenever you attach a basic Energy card from your hand to Forretress (excluding effects of attacks), you may flip a coin. If tails, put 2 damage counters on each Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's) (excluding any Forretress).

attacks.name: Explosion
attacks.text: Forretress does 40 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: It is encased in a steel shell. Its peering eyes are all that can be seen of its mysterious innards.

data.name: Wailord

abilities.name: Sleeping Pulse
abilities.text: As long as Wailord remains Asleep between turns, remove 1 damage counter from Wailord.

attacks.name: Sink Deep
attacks.text: If Wailord has any damage counters on it, Wailord is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: The biggest of all Pokémon. It can dive to a depth of almost 10,000 feet on only one breath.

data.name: Mantine

attacks.name: Water Reserve
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 3 Water Energy cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.flavorText: If it builds up enough speed swimming, it can jump out above the waves and glide for over 300 feet.

abilities.name: Synchronicity
abilities.text: You may attach any Technical Machine to Xatu.

attacks.name: Warp Hole
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose a card from your discard pile and put it on top of your deck.

data.name: Magneton

attacks.name: Zap Cannon
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't use Zap Cannon during your next turn.

data.flavorText: It has about three times the electrical power of Magnemite. For some reason, outbreaks of this Pokémon happen when lots of sunspots appear.

data.name: Pikachu

attacks.name: Thundershock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: It occasionally uses an electric shock to recharge a fellow Pikachu that is in a weakened state.

data.name: Magmar

attacks.name: Heat Breath
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

data.flavorText: Its entire body is burning. When it breathes, the temperature rises. When it sneezes, flames shoot out!

data.name: Onix-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Bind
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Rocky Avalanche-GX
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 100 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance). (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

abilities.name: Install
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), move a Technical Machine card attached to 1 of your Pokémon to another of your Pokémon. This power can't be used if Porygon-Z is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Learning
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Pokémon LV.X that levels up from 1 of your Pokémon, and put it onto that Pokémon. (This counts as leveling up that Pokémon.) Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Overload
attacks.text: Does 40 damage plus 20 more damage for each Technical Machine card attached to Porygon-Z.

data.name: Cinderace

attacks.name: Pyro Ball
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Burning Kick
attacks.text: Discard all Energy from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It juggles a pebble with its feet, turning it into a burning soccer ball. Its shots strike opponents hard and leave them scorched.

data.name: Litwick

attacks.name: Find a Friend
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Fire Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.flavorText: While shining a light and pretending to be a guide, it leeches off the life force of any who follow it.

data.name: Zekrom

attacks.name: Outrage
attacks.text: Does 10 more damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Bolt Strike
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 40 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: This Pokémon appears in legends. In its tail, it has a giant generator that creates electricity.

data.name: Manaphy

abilities.name: Final Wish
abilities.text: When this Pokémon is Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack, search your deck for a card and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Seafaring
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. For each heads, attach a Water Energy card from your discard pile to your Benched Pokémon in any way you like.

data.flavorText: It is born with a wondrous power that lets it bond with any kind of Pokémon.

attacks.name: Hypnotic Gaze
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Fire Ring
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose 1 of them and this attack does 10 damage to it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Milotic

attacks.name: TLC
attacks.text: Shuffle 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon that has any damage counters on it and all cards attached to it into their deck.

attacks.name: Ocean Cyclone
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: Milotic has provided inspiration to many artists. It has even been referred to as the most beautiful Pokémon of all.

data.name: Duosion

attacks.name: Double Link
attacks.text: If Solosis is on your Bench, this attack does 30 more damage. If Duosion is on your Bench, this attack does 60 more damage.

data.flavorText: When their two divided brains think the same thoughts, their psychic power is maximized.

attacks.name: Overrun
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 of them and this attack does 10 damage to it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Dark Flaaffy

attacks.name: High Voltage
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent can't play Trainer cards during his or her next turn.

attacks.name: Stun Wave
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has a Pokémon Power, that power stops working until the end of your next turn.

data.flavorText: As a result of storing massive amounts of electricity there, it can no longer grow wool on certain areas of its body.

data.name: Seel

attacks.name: Growl
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done by attacks from the Defending Pokémon is reduced by 20 (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.flavorText: Covered with light blue fur, its hide is thick and tough. It is active in bitter cold of -40 degrees Fahrenheit.

data.name: Pyroar

attacks.name: Crunch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Royal Flare
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: The male with the largest mane of fire is the leader of the pride.

data.name: Lunatone

abilities.name: Marvel Eyes
abilities.text: If you have Solrock in play, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to any of your Lunatone or Solrock by your opponent's Pokémon LV.X.

attacks.name: Gravity Wave
attacks.text: Does 30 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon that doesn't have a Retreat Cost. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: Because it turns active on nights of the full moon, it is said to have some link to the lunar phases.

data.name: Bayleef

attacks.name: Sweet Scent
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads and if any of your Pokémon have any damage counters on them, then remove 2 damage counters from 1 of them (or 1 if it only has 1). If tails and if any of your opponent's Pokémon have any damage counters on them, choose 1 of them and remove 2 damage counters from it (or 1 if it only has 1).

attacks.name: Double Razor Leaf
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: The scent of spices comes from around its neck. Somehow, sniffing it makes you want to fight.

data.name: Gastly

attacks.name: Lick
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Night Shade
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: Born from gases, anyone would faint if engulfed by its gaseous body, which contains poison.

data.name: Deoxys

attacks.name: Close Encounter
attacks.text: If you go first, you can use this attack on your first turn. Draw 2 cards.

attacks.name: Overdrive Smash
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon's Overdrive Smash attack does 60 more damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.flavorText: DNA from a space virus mutated and became a Pokémon. It appears where auroras are seen.

data.name: Dewgong

attacks.name: Ice Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: Stores thermal energy in its body. Swims at a steady 8 knots even in intensely cold waters.

data.name: Dark Charmeleon

attacks.name: Fireball
attacks.text: Use this attack only if there are any Fire Energy cards attached to Dark Charmeleon. Flip a coin. If heads, discard 1 of those Energy cards. If tails, this attack does nothing (not even damage).

data.flavorText: Its tail is incredibly strong, able to lift up to 5 adult men.

data.name: Dark Flaaffy
rules: This Pokémon is both Lightning Darkness type.

attacks.name: Thunder Slash
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is a Basic Pokémon, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed. Dark Flaaffy can't use Thunder Slash during your next turn.

attacks.name: Shake
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, he or she chooses 1 of them and switches it with the Defending Pokémon. (Do the damage before switching the Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Fire Tackle
attacks.text: Blaine's Growlithe does 10 damage to itself.

data.name: Plusle

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: – Boost
attacks.text: If Minun is on your Bench, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage.

data.flavorText: It cheers on friends with pom-poms made of sparks. It drains power from telephone poles.

abilities.name: Extra Feather
abilities.text: Each of your Stage 2 Pokémon-ex does 10 more damage to the Defending Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Keldeo

attacks.name: Bail Out
attacks.text: Put a Water Pokémon from your discard pile into your hand.

attacks.name: Resolute Blade
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage for each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It crosses the world, running over the surfaces of oceans and rivers. It appears at scenic waterfronts.

attacks.name: Earthquake
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each of your own Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Double Stab
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Mareep

attacks.name: Cotton Guard
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to this Pokémon by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Thunder Jolt
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: Its fluffy coat swells to double when static electricity builds up. Touching it can be shocking.

data.name: Mudkip
data.flavorText: To alert it, the fin on its head senses the flow of water. It has the strength to heft boulders.

data.name: Magikarp

attacks.name: Flail
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the number of damage counters on Magikarp.

data.flavorText: In the distant past, it was stronger than its horribly weak descendants that exist today.

abilities.name: Poison Structure
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Sidney's Stadium is in play, you may choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon. That Pokémon is now Poisoned. This power can't be used if Cacturne is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Pin Missile
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Virizion-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Double Draw
attacks.text: Draw 2 cards.

attacks.name: Sensitive Blade
attacks.text: If you played a Supporter card from your hand during this turn, this attack does 80 more damage.

attacks.name: Breeze Away-GX
attacks.text: Put any number of your Pokémon in play and all cards attached to them into your hand. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

attacks.name: Thunder Throw
attacks.text: Choose 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage to each of them. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Repeat Lightning
attacks.text: Does 30 damage plus 10 more damage for each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon that has any damage counters on it.
